.widget_width {
   width: 100%;
}











































!! Record: <<dataTid>>

<$vars dataTid={{{ [<dataTid>is[tiddler]] [<currentTiddler>addsuffix[ Data]] +[first[]] }}}>
<fieldset class="std_fs">
<legend>Customer Type</legend>
<<RadioWidget field:"cust-type" value:"person"        label:"A Person"       >><br>
<<RadioWidget field:"cust-type" value:"corporation" label:"A Corporation">>
</fieldset>
<$list filter="[<dataTid>get[cust-type]match[person]then<dataTid>]">
{{||Person Names}}
</$list>
<$list filter="[<dataTid>get[cust-type]match[corporation]then<dataTid>]">
{{||Corporation Name}}
</$list>
{{||Postal Address}}
</$vars>












\define AddCustomer()
<$vars NewCustomerId={{{ [all[tiddlers]regexp[cust-]removeprefix[cust-]else[0]maxall[]add[1]pad[6,0]addprefix[cust-]] }}}>
<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<NewCustomerId>> $field="text" $value=" "/>
<$action-sendmessage $message="tm-modal" $param={{Forms Modalizer!!title}} dataTid=<<NewCustomerId>> RecordType="customer"/>
</$vars>
\end

<$button actions=<<AddCustomer>>>
Add a New Customer
</$button>

----

<$list variable="customerTid" filter="[all[tiddlers]regexp[cust-]]">

<$button>
<$action-sendmessage $message="tm-modal" $param={{Customer Form!!title}} dataTid=<<customerTid>> recordType="customer"/>
Edit
</$button>
<$link to=<<customerTid>> /> <$text text={{{ [<customerTid>get[first-name]] }}}/> <$text text={{{ [<customerTid>get[last-name]] }}}/> <$text text={{{ [<customerTid>get[name]] }}}/>

</$list>







!!! [[Customizations]]

{{Macros||tAsDc}}

{{StyleSheets||tAsDc}}

{{Transclusion Templates||tAsDc}}

{{Context Configuration||tAsDc}}






* {{Database Programming||tAsDc}}
* [[Architecting Forms Applications]]






Although TW "data tiddlers" are generally considered a convenience used in a limited set of circumstances, I tend to favour data tiddlers instead of fields for storing data values.  

Regardless, wherever you see data tiddlers being used (along with "index" references to values in those data tiddlers,) the very same could be done with tiddler fields.

----
!! Some Practices

* [[A Tiddler Should Not Contain Both Data and Widgets]]
* [[Widgets Tiddlers Step 1: a DataTid Variable]]

----
!! References

* [[About Data Tiddlers (tiddlywiki.com)|https://tiddlywiki.com/#DataTiddlers]]
* [[For structured data, do you prefer indexes (and data tiddlers) or fields ? (Google Groups conversation)|https://groups.google.com/g/tiddlywiki/c/lNI8i63ro2A]]






/* details and summary colours */

/*
details {
   background-color: <<colour tiddler-info-tab-background>>;
   color: <<colour foreground>>;
}
*/

details {
   background-color: #fefefe;
   border-style: solid;
   border-color: LightGray;
   border-width: thin;
   color: <<colour foreground>>;
}

details summary {
   background-color: <<colour dropdown-tab-background>>;
}

details.plain summary {
    background-color: <<colour dropdown-tab-background>>;
    /* TW leaves color undefined/uses foreground */
}

details.notification summary {
    background-color: <<colour notification-background>>;
    /* TW leaves color undefined/uses foreground */
}

details.warning summary {
    background-color: #ffbbaf;
    color: #000;
}

details.success summary {
    background-color: #88edc5;
    color: #000;
}

<$list filter="[<vCurrentTab>match[Open]then[40%]] [<vCurrentTab>match{Kiosk Gadget!!title}then[40%]]  [<vCurrentTab>match[Recent]then[35%]] +[else[25%]]">
{{!!title}}
</$list>

</$vars>

\end

}

  border:none;
  vertical-align:top;}

.std_lbl {
  width:12em;}

.std_tr {
  border:none;
  border-bottom:1px solid lightblue;}

.std_tbl {
  border:none;
  width:100%;}

.std_widget {
  margin:2px 0 2px 0;
  width:100%;}

{{ UID-Permalink Project || tAsDc}}

[[Tag Selector]]







* `[[1]match[1]]` = <$text text={{{ [[1]match[1]] }}} />
** when some expression results in one or more items, this scenario becomes equivalent to IF condition = TRUE
* `[[1]match[2]]` = <$text text={{{ [[1]match[2]] }}} />
** //(i.e. "no value" or "nothing")//
** when some expression results in no items, this scenario becomes equivalent to IF condition = FALSE

!!! If Then-Else as a step in a dominant filter run
* //(I think of this kind of filter as a "raw materials factory")//
!!!

* `[[1]match[1]then[Result for Condition being TRUE]]` = <$text text={{{ [[1]match[1]then[Result for Condition being TRUE]] }}} />
* `[[1]match[2]else[Result for Condition being FALSE]]` = <$text text={{{ [[1]match[2]else[Result for Condition being FALSE]] }}} />

!!! If Then-Else as a primary step in a non-dominant filter run
* //(I think of this kind of filter as a "finished goods factory")//
!!!

* `[[1]match[1]] +[then[Result for Condition being TRUE]]` = <$text text={{{ [[1]match[1]] +[then[Result for Condition being TRUE]]}}}/>
* `[[1]match[2]] +[else[Result for Condition being FALSE]]` = <$text  text={{{ [[1]match[2]] +[else[Result for Condition being FALSE]]}}}/>






{{How To#️⃣IfTE||tAsDc}}






&emsp;






\define AddTiddlyWikiTopic( topic )
<option value={{{ [[$topic$]split[ ]join[%2520]addprefix[https://tiddlywiki.com/static/]addsuffix[.html]] }}}>$topic$</option>
\end

\define AddWikipediaTopic( topic )
<option value={{{ [[$topic$]encodeuri[]addprefix[https://en.m.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=]addsuffix[&mobileaction=toggle_view_mobile]] }}}>$topic$</option>
\end

<$link to={{Kiosk Gadget!!title}}>{{Kiosk Gadget!!caption}} </$link><$select tiddler={{Kiosk Gadget!!title}} field="curr-topic">
<!--🔴 Embedded Google Calendar -->
<!-- Learn how to embed your own Google Calendar at
       https://support.google.com/calendar/answer/41207?hl=en-->
<option value="https://calendar.google.com/calendar/embed?height=600&amp;wkst=1&amp;bgcolor=%23ffffff&amp;ctz=America%2FHalifax&amp;src=czIydmhibGo2dTBzMW9ybXEzbzhjYjQzMThAZ3JvdXAuY2FsZW5kYXIuZ29vZ2xlLmNvbQ&amp;color=%23E67C73&amp;mode=MONTH&amp;showTabs=0&amp;showTitle=0">Calendar</option>
<!--🔴 TiddlyWiki.com Grouping of Tiddler Titles -->
<optgroup label="TiddlyWiki">
<<AddTiddlyWikiTopic  "HelloThere">>
<<AddTiddlyWikiTopic  "Philosophy of Tiddlers">>
<<AddTiddlyWikiTopic  "Custom styles by data-tiddler-title">>
<<AddTiddlyWikiTopic  "Macros in WikiText">>
<<AddTiddlyWikiTopic  "Widgets">>
<<AddTiddlyWikiTopic  "Filter Operators">>
</optgroup>
<!--🔴 Wikipedia.en Grouping of Article Titles -->
<optgroup label="Wikipedia">
<<AddWikipediaTopic  "Macro (computer science)">>
<<AddWikipediaTopic  "TiddlyWiki">>
<<AddWikipediaTopic  "WikiWikiWeb">>
<<AddWikipediaTopic  "Project Xanadu">>
</optgroup>
</$select>&nbsp;&nbsp;<a href={{Kiosk Gadget!!curr-topic}} title="Open web page in a separate window/tab"  target="_blank">open</a>
<iframe  src={{Kiosk Gadget!!curr-topic}} height="500" width="100%"></iframe>






{{ What are Macros ? || tAsDc }}

{{ Tutorial 1: A Simple Macro || tAsDc }}

{{Video#️⃣MacrosTutorial1 || tAsDc}}






In tutorial 1, we created the following macro in the "stereotypical" form:

<<<
```
\define Indent()
&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
\end
```
<<<

When defining macros with a snippet of text that has no more than one line, we can use a short-hand notation that fits on one line and omits the `\end` marker.

So the aforementioned macro can be written (in short form) as: 

<<<
```
\define Indent() &nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;
```
<<<

As an exercise and using [[A Basic Macro: The Indent Macro]], replace the macro (in "stereotypical" form) with the short form version.







<div style="border:1px solid lightgray;">
<center>

''The Goal:  We need a macro that can add any number of spaces, depending on a number value in one parameter.  Since the macro will be mostly used for first-line indents //(5 spaces)// to parapraphs, it ought to give 5 spaces by default (when the macro is referenced without parameters), 

''

</center>
</div>

As sample text for our macro "programming", we will use a version of the "Good, Bad, Maybe" story from [[John Suler's Zen Stories to Tell Your Neighbors|http://truecenterpublishing.com/zenstory/maybe.html]].

{{ The "Maybe" Story, raw text || tAsDc }}

{{ Aside: A little bit of research on spaces || tAsDc }}

{{ A Basic Macro: The Indent Macro || tAsDc }}

{{ What are Macro Parameters ?  || tAsDc }}

{{ The "Generalized" Space Macro || tAsDc}}

<$vars Tiddler1={{Sample Tiddler A!!title}}
           OtherTiddlers="Sample Tiddler Z;Sample Tiddler B;Sample Tiddler D" >

<table>
<$list variable="TiddlerX" filter="[<OtherTiddlers>split[;]sort[]]">
<tr>
<td><$link to=<<Tiddler1>>/>
</td>
<td><$text text={{{ [<Tiddler1>links[]match<TiddlerX>then[-->]] [<TiddlerX>links[]match<Tiddler1>then[<--]] }}}/>
</td>
<td><$link to=<<TiddlerX>>/>
</td>
</tr>
</$list>
</table>

</$vars>

\define CreateMissingTiddlersNow()
<$list variable="woohooTiddler" filter="[all[tiddlers]!is[system]links[]is[missing]sort[]]">
<$action-createtiddler $basetitle=<<woohooTiddler>> text="Some text, ideally a transclusion of content from some tiddler."/>
</$list>
\end

<$button>
<<CreateMissingTiddlersNow>>
Create Missing Tiddlers Now
</$button>

<table>
<tr>
<th> There are Links to These Missing Tiddlers </th>
<th> Tiddlers With Those Links </th>
</tr>
<$list variable="thisTiddler" filter="[all[tiddlers]!is[system]links[]!is[system]is[missing]sort[]]">
<tr>
<td>
<<thisTiddler>><br>
</td>
<td style="background-color:#fafafa">
<$vars theseBacklinks={{{ [<thisTiddler>backlinks[]join[, ]] }}}>
<<theseBacklinks>>
</$vars>
</td>
</tr>
</$list>
</table>

!!!!! //(requires OokTech's [[Timer Actions plugin|$:/plugins/OokTech/TimerActions]])//

<$set name="vstate" tiddler="$:/plugins/OokTech/TimerActions/TaskList" index={{RSIL Timer!!title}}>

<$button  disabled={{{ [<vstate>match[false]else[yes]] }}}>
<$action-setfield $tiddler="$:/plugins/OokTech/TimerActions/TaskList" $index={{RSIL Timer!!title}} $value="true"/>
Go
</$button>
<$button disabled={{{ [<vstate>match[false]then[yes]] }}}>
<$action-setfield $tiddler="$:/plugins/OokTech/TimerActions/TaskList" $index={{RSIL Timer!!title}} $value="false"/>
Stop
</$button>
<$button disabled={{{ [<vstate>match[false]else[yes]] }}}>
<$action-setfield $tiddler={{!!title}} $field="c" $value="1"/>
<$action-setfield $tiddler={{!!title}} $field="pi" $value="0"/>
Reset
</$button>

//(NOTE: after "Go" button is pressed, it takes two or three seconds for the looping process to begin)//
</$set>


* C: {{!!c}}
* PI:  {{!!pi}}

---
!!! Code above based on the following code from [[The VIC-20 Programmer's Reference Guide]]<br>
//(Here, the code can be stopped via "run-stop" button, but then continued with a "CONT" command.)//
```
10 PI = 0; C = 1
20 PI = PI + 4/C - 4/(C + 2)
30 PRINT PI
40 C = C + 4:GOTO 20```






\define play_again()
<$action-setfield $tiddler={{{ [all[current]addsuffix[ Data]] }}} $index="state" $value="bet_pending"/>

<!-- 🔴 Main Deck: Get  -->
<$vars deck={{{ [range[2,14]addsuffix[.1]] [range[2,14]addsuffix[.2]] [range[2,14]addsuffix[.3]] [range[2,14]addsuffix[.4]] +[pad[4],[0]] +[sort[]] +[join[ ]] }}}>

<!-- 🔴 Low Card: Get  -->
<$action-randval $tiddler={{{ [all[current]addsuffix[ Data]] }}} $field="card1" $lower="1" $upper="44"/>
<$vars lowcard={{{ [all[current]addsuffix[ Data]get[card1]]}}}>
<$action-setfield $tiddler={{{ [all[current]addsuffix[ Data]] }}} $field="card1" $value={{{[<deck>split[ ]nth<lowcard>]}}}/>

<!-- 🔴 High Card: Get
<$vars deck2={{{ [<deck> +[split[ ]] +[max[<lowcard>.5]] +[!match[<lowcard>.5]]] +[join[ ]] }}}>
<$vars deck2count={{{ [<deck2> +[split[ ]] +[count[]]}}}>
<$action-randval $tiddler={{{ [all[current]addsuffix[ Data]] }}} $field="card3" $lower="1" $upper=<<deckcount2>>/>
<$vars highcard={{{ [all[current]addsuffix[ Data]get[card3]]}}}>
<$action-setfield $tiddler={{{ [all[current]addsuffix[ Data]] }}} $field="card3" $value={{{[<deck>split[ ]nth<highcard>]}}}/>
-->

<!-- 🔴 Middle Card: Get
<$action-randval $tiddler={{{ [all[current]addsuffix[ Data]] }}} $field="card2" $lower="2" $upper="14"/>
🔴 Middle Card: Done  -->

<!-- 🔴 High Card: Done 
</$vars>
</$vars>
</$vars>
-->
<!-- 🔴 Low Card: Done  -->
</$vars>
<!-- 🔴 Main Deck: Done  -->
</$vars>
\end












<$vars vSidebarTabStateTid={{{ [all[tiddlers]regexp[state/tab/sidebar]] }}}>
<$vars vCurrentTab= {{{ [<vSidebarTabStateTid>get[text]removeprefix[$:/core/ui/SideBar/]] }}}>

<$list filter="[<vCurrentTab>match[Open]then[40%]] [<vCurrentTab>match[Recent]then[15%]] +[else[25%]]">
{{!!title}}
</$list>

</$vars>
</$vars>

        <td class="std_td">

      </tr>

        <td class="std_td">
            Street Type:
        </td>

        </td>
      </tr>
      <tr class="std_tr">
        <td class="std_td">
            Municipality Name:
        </td>

            <$edit-text tiddler=<<GetDataTid>> field="municipality-name" class="std_widget" class="std_widget"/>
        </td>
      </tr>
      <tr class="std_tr">
        <td class="std_td">
            Province or Territory:
        </td>
        <td class="std_td">
            <$edit-text tiddler=<<GetDataTid>> field="prov-terr" class="std_widget"/>
        </td>
      </tr>

            Postal Code:
        </td>
        <td class="std_td">
            <$edit-text tiddler=<<GetDataTid>> field="postal-code" class="std_widget"/>
        </td>
      </tr>

    </table>

//These fields are based on, and a subset of, the address fields specified in [[Canada Post Corporation's Addressing Guidelines|https://www.canadapost-postescanada.ca/tools/pg/manual/PGaddress-e.asp?ecid=murl10006450#1417752]].//

{{Looping and Decision Making||tAsDc}}


















* [[Railroad Plugin Syntax]]






<$railroad text=""" ["+"]
({ [[digit|GettingStarted]] } | "#" <'escape sequence'>)
[{("@" name-char | :"--" )}] """/>






| !`<$railroad text=""" """/>` |<|<|
|| !`text=` | !`result`  |
|| `""" """` | <$railroad text=""" """/> |
|command ?| `""" alpha """` | <$railroad text=""" alpha """/> |
|variable ? | `""" "alpha" """` | <$railroad text=""" "alpha" """/> |
|repeat | `""" {alpha} """` | <$railroad text=""" {alpha} """/> |
|| `""" [alpha] """` | <$railroad text=""" [alpha] """/> |
|| `""" [: alpha] """` | <$railroad text=""" [: alpha] """/> |
|| `""" [{alpha}] """` | <$railroad text=""" [{alpha}] """/> |
|| `""" [:{alpha}] """` | <$railroad text=""" [:{alpha}] """/> |
|| `""" alpha beta """`| <$railroad text=""" alpha beta """/> |
|| `""" {alpha + beta} """` | <$railroad text=""" {alpha + beta} """/> |
|| `""" [{alpha + beta}] """` | <$railroad text=""" [{alpha + beta}] """/> |


<$railroad text=""" (delta alpha beta) """/>







```
<$list filter="[relink:references<currentTiddler>!title[$:/StoryList]sort[title]]">

* {{||fLm}}
</$list>
```


<$list filter="[relink:references<currentTiddler>!title[$:/StoryList]sort[title]]">

* {{||fLm}}
</$list>






* https://www.w3schools.com/cssref/css3_pr_resize.asp

<div style="resize:both;overflow:auto;width:4em;height:4em;background-color:yellow;border:1px solid black;min-height:3em;min-width:3em;">
</div>

Sadly, there seems to be no CSS-only solution for proportional dynamic font resizing as a parent element gets resized.  For simple dynamic resizing of text in TiddlyWiki, I'm thinking of the following two possibilities:

* a button to adjust text size
* OR, buttons for resizing a parent element, which also porportionally resizes text size
** benefit here is resizing can be saved, whereas we can't easily save resize of element via resizeable Div feature
* OR button to adjust text size AND buttons to adjust element size


!! Example with div within resizeable div + font-size at 75%

<div style="resize:both;overflow:auto;width:8em;height:4em;background-color:yellow;border:1px solid black;min-height:3em;min-width:3em;">
<div style="min-width:200px;font-size: 75%;">
{{Graphics}}
</div>
</div>






<$vars vtid={{PI Calculation Loop!!title}}>
<$vars vc={{{ [<vtid>get[c]] }}} vpi={{{ [<vtid>get[pi]] }}}>
<$vars vp1={{{[[4]divide<vc>add<vpi>]}}} vp2={{{ [<vc>add[2]]}}}>
<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<vtid>> $field="pi" $value={{{ [[4]divide<vp2>negate[]add<vp1>] }}}/>
</$vars>
</$vars>
<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<vtid>> $field="c" $value={{{ [<vtid>get[c]add[4]]}}}/>
</$vars>






[[Sample Tiddler B]]
[[Sample Tiddler C]]






[[Sample Tiddler A]]






''Remember:  Everything in TiddlyWiki involves a tiddler.''

In this TiddlyWiki, the sidebar tab has specified widths for the Open and the Recent tabs.  For all other tabs, the sidebar has a default width.

!! The Solution

The solution to "dynamic" sidebar width involves dynamic value in the [[Sidebar width|$:/themes/tiddlywiki/vanilla/metrics/sidebarwidth]] value entered via the $:/ControlPanel's "Theme Tweaks" tab (found in the "Appearance" tab.)  Sidebar width is at the very bottom.

//NOTE: "size" settings are often "px" values.  For my purposes, I have "%" values in many of  my settings, including width.  If you use "px" values for all of your settings, replace my setup instructions and sample tiddler content with "px" values instead of "%" values.//

# Create a tiddler that dynamically generates sidebar width value.
#* A like [[DynamicSidebarWidth]], or simply copy this tiddler to your TiddlyWiki and modify it as needed.
# In $:/ControlPanel, set the sidebar width value to the transclusion of the dynamic sidebar width tiddler
#* For example, this TiddlyWiki has the sidebar width value = `{{DynamicSidebarWidth}}`






* [[Basic Macro Example Notes]]

---

!! Macro Examples
<$list filter="[tag[pMacroE]sort[]]">
<$link/>; 
</$list>






all ''kinds'' of text, eh?  Woohoo?






<$list filter="[range[0, 800, 10]]">
<$vars vy=<<currentTiddler>>>
<$list filter="[range[0, 800, 15]]">
<$vars vx=<<currentTiddler>>>
<line x1="0" y1="0" x2=<<vx>> y2=<<vy>> style="stroke:gold;stroke-width:0.1" />
</$vars>
</$list>
</$vars>
</$list>






Based on the {{"Sunlights" Blockly Program||fLm}}

<svg width="800" height="800">
  <circle cx="50" cy="50" r="100" stroke="brown" stroke-width="1" fill="red" />
{{Sunlight Lines SVG Loop}}
</svg>

* __attribution__:  [[A Guide to SVG Animations (SMIL)|https://css-tricks.com/guide-svg-animations-smil/]], by Sara Soueidan

!!! Click circle to animate

<svg width="800" height="100" style="border: 1px solid black;">

<circle id="my-circle" r="30" cx="50" cy="50" fill="orange" />

  <animate 
    xlink:href="#my-circle"
    attributeName="cx"
    from="50"
    to="450" 
    dur="1s"
    begin="click"
    fill="freeze" />

</svg>

!!! Click circle to animate //(square animates 1.5 seconds after)//

<svg width="800" height="200" style="border: 1px solid black;">

<circle id="orange-circle" r="30" cx="50" cy="50" fill="orange" />

<rect id="blue-rectangle" width="50" height="50" x="25" y="100" fill="blue" />

  <animate 
    xlink:href="#orange-circle"
    attributeName="cx"
    from="50"
    to="450" 
    dur="5s"
    begin="click"
    fill="freeze" 
    id="circ-anim" />

  <animate 
    xlink:href="#blue-rectangle"
    attributeName="x" 
    from="50"
    to="425" 
    dur="5s"
    begin="circ-anim.begin + 1s"
    fill="freeze" 
    id="rect-anim" />

</svg>

!!! Infinite animation

<svg version="1.1" width="320" height="320" viewBox="0 0 320 320" fill="none" stroke="#000" stroke-linecap="round"
     xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink"  style="border: 1px solid black;">
  <defs>
    <path id="r1">
      <animate id="p1" attributeName="d" values="m160,160l0,0 0,0;m130,110l30,-17 30,17;m130,60l30,-17 30,17;m160,20l0,0 0,0" dur="6s" repeatCount="indefinite"/>
      <animate attributeName="stroke-width" values="0;4;4;4;0" dur="6s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="p1.begin"/>
    </path>
    <path id="r2">
      <animate attributeName="d" values="m160,160l0,0 0,0;m130,110l30,-17 30,17;m130,60l30,-17 30,17;m160,20l0,0 0,0" dur="6s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="p1.begin+1s"/>
      <animate attributeName="stroke-width" values="0;4;4;4;0" dur="6s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="p1.begin+1s"/>
    </path>
    <path id="r3">
      <animate attributeName="d" values="m160,160l0,0 0,0;m130,110l30,-17 30,17;m130,60l30,-17 30,17;m160,20l0,0 0,0" dur="6s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="p1.begin+2s"/>
      <animate attributeName="stroke-width" values="0;4;4;4;0" dur="6s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="p1.begin+2s"/>
    </path>
    <path id="r4">
      <animate id="p1" attributeName="d" values="m160,160l0,0 0,0;m130,110l30,-17 30,17;m130,60l30,-17 30,17;m160,20l0,0 0,0" dur="6s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="p1.begin+3s"/>
      <animate attributeName="stroke-width" values="0;4;4;4;0" dur="6s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="p1.begin+3s"/>
    </path>
    <path id="r5">
      <animate attributeName="d" values="m160,160l0,0 0,0;m130,110l30,-17 30,17;m130,60l30,-17 30,17;m160,20l0,0 0,0" dur="6s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="p1.begin+4s"/>
      <animate attributeName="stroke-width" values="0;4;4;4;0" dur="6s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="p1.begin+4s"/>
    </path>
    <path id="r6">
      <animate attributeName="d" values="m160,160l0,0 0,0;m130,110l30,-17 30,17;m130,60l30,-17 30,17;m160,20l0,0 0,0" dur="6s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="p1.begin+5s"/>
      <animate attributeName="stroke-width" values="0;4;4;4;0" dur="6s" repeatCount="indefinite" begin="p1.begin+5s"/>
    </path>
  </defs>
  <use xlink:href="#r1"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r1" transform="rotate(60 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r1" transform="rotate(120 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r1" transform="rotate(180 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r1" transform="rotate(240 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r1" transform="rotate(300 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r2" transform="rotate(30 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r2" transform="rotate(90 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r2" transform="rotate(150 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r2" transform="rotate(210 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r2" transform="rotate(270 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r2" transform="rotate(330 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r3"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r3" transform="rotate(60 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r3" transform="rotate(120 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r3" transform="rotate(180 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r3" transform="rotate(240 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r3" transform="rotate(300 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r4" transform="rotate(30 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r4" transform="rotate(90 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r4" transform="rotate(150 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r4" transform="rotate(210 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r4" transform="rotate(270 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r4" transform="rotate(330 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r5"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r5" transform="rotate(60 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r5" transform="rotate(120 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r5" transform="rotate(180 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r5" transform="rotate(240 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r5" transform="rotate(300 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r6" transform="rotate(30 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r6" transform="rotate(90 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r6" transform="rotate(150 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r6" transform="rotate(210 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r6" transform="rotate(270 160 160)"/>
  <use xlink:href="#r6" transform="rotate(330 160 160)"/>
</svg>

!!! Moving a circle on a path

<svg width="500" height="350" viewBox="0 0 500 350"  style="border: 1px solid black;">
  <path id="motionPath" fill="none" stroke="#000000" stroke-miterlimit="10" d="M202.4,58.3c-13.8,0.1-33.3,0.4-44.8,9.2
  c-14,10.7-26.2,29.2-31.9,45.6c-7.8,22.2-13.5,48-3.5,70.2c12.8,28.2,47.1,43.6,68.8,63.6c19.6,18.1,43.4,26.1,69.5,29.4
  c21.7,2.7,43.6,3.3,65.4,4.7c19.4,1.3,33.9-7.7,51.2-15.3c24.4-10.7,38.2-44,40.9-68.9c1.8-16.7,3.4-34.9-10.3-46.5
  c-9.5-8-22.6-8.1-33.2-14.1c-13.7-7.7-27.4-17.2-39.7-26.8c-5.4-4.2-10.4-8.8-15.8-12.9c-4.5-3.5-8.1-8.3-13.2-11
  c-6.2-3.3-14.3-5.4-20.9-8.2c-5-2.1-9.5-5.2-14.3-7.6c-6.5-3.3-12.1-7.4-19.3-8.9c-6-1.2-12.4-1.3-18.6-1.5
  C222.5,59,212.5,57.8,202.4,58.3"/>
  
  <circle id="circle" r="10" cx="0" cy="0" fill="tomato" />
   
  <animateMotion 
           xlink:href="#circle"
           dur="5s"
           begin="0s"
           fill="freeze"
           repeatCount="indefinite">
    <mpath xlink:href="#motionPath" />
  </animateMotion>
</svg>

!!! Cool animation

<svg viewBox="0 0 160 160" width="160" height="160" style="background-color:#FC0">
  <circle cx="80" cy="80" r="50" />
  <g transform=" matrix(0.866, -0.5, 0.25, 0.433, 80, 80)">
    <path d="M 0,70 A 65,70 0 0,0 65,0 5,5 0 0,1 75,0 75,70 0 0,1 0,70Z" fill="#FFF">
      <animateTransform attributeName="transform" type="rotate" from="360 0 0" to="0 0 0" dur="1s" repeatCount="indefinite" />
    </path>
  </g>
  <path d="M 50,0 A 50,50 0 0,0 -50,0Z" transform="matrix(0.866, -0.5, 0.5, 0.866, 80, 80)" />
</svg>






* [[Sunlight SVG]]
* [[SVG Animations]]






{{Sunlight SVG}}






<$list filter="[<currentTiddler>!is[tiddler]]">
<$button>
<$action-createtiddler $basetitle=<<currentTiddler>> tags="TODO"/>
Create ''<<currentTiddler>>'' TODO tiddler
</$button>
</$list>
<$list filter="[<currentTiddler>is[tiddler]]">
[[TODO]]: <$link/>
</$list>






<!-- "thisTiddler" is a variable which has the name of the tiddler being edited by the Tag Selector presented as a modal window -->
@@.multicol
<$list variable="thisTag" filter="[tags[]sort[]]">
<$checkbox tiddler=<<thisTiddler>> tag=<<thisTag>>> <<thisTag>></$checkbox><br> 
</$list>
@@

---
!!! This Dialog Needs/Uses The Following Tiddlers
* [[multicol]]
* [[Tag Selector Button]]
* [[Tag Selector Button Img]]
* [[Tag Selector Button Hint]]
* [[Tag Selector Caption]]






<$button tooltip={{Tag Selector Button Hint}} aria-label={{Tag Selector Caption}} class=<<tv-config-toolbar-class>>>
<$action-sendmessage $message="tm-modal" $param={{Tag Selector!!title}} thisTiddler=<<currentTiddler>>/>
{{Tag Selector Button Img}}
<span class="tc-btn-text">
<$text text=" "/>
{{Tag Selector Caption}}
</span>
</$button>






Select the tags for a tiddler via a modal window.

<div style="font-size:0.65em;line-height:1.25em;text-align:center;">
Tag<br>Selector
</div>






<$details summary={{{ [all[current]split[#️⃣]!is[blank]nth[]] }}} >

<div style="height:1px;margin:0 0 -9px 0;">
<div style="float:right;margin:-15px -6px 0 0;text-align:center;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;width: 40px;background-color:white;height:20px;border-color:gray;">
^^<$link to={{!!title}}  tooltip="Open Transcluded Source Tiddler">🐟</$link> <$button message=tm-open-window param={{!!title}} class=tc-btn-invisible tooltip="Open Related Tiddler in New Window" >{{$:/core/images/open-window}}</$button>^^
</div>

</div>

{{!!text}}

</$details>







<$details summary={{{ [all[current]split[#️⃣]!is[blank]nth[]] }}} open="yes" >

<div style="height:1px;margin:0 0 -9px 0;">
<div style="float:right;margin:-15px -6px 0 0;text-align:center;border-style:solid;border-width:1px;width: 40px;background-color:white;height:20px;border-color:gray;">
^^<$link to={{!!title}}  tooltip="Open Transcluded Source Tiddler">🐟</$link> <$button message=tm-open-window param={{!!title}} class=tc-btn-invisible tooltip="Open Related Tiddler in New Window" >{{$:/core/images/open-window}}</$button>^^
</div>

</div>

{{!!text}}

</$details>







{{||GetDataTid}}

* <$text text={{GetDataTid}}/>






---
!!! Sample Text for Testing

There is a Taoist story of an old farmer who had worked his crops for many years. One day his horse ran away. Upon hearing the news, his neighbors came to visit. "Such bad luck," they said sympathetically. "May be," the farmer replied.

The next morning the horse returned, bringing with it three other wild horses. "How wonderful," the neighbors exclaimed. "May be," replied the old man.

The following day, his son tried to ride one of the untamed horses, was thrown, and broke his leg. The neighbors again came to offer their sympathy on his misfortune. "May be," answered the farmer.

The day after, military officials came to the village to draft young men into the army. Seeing that the son's leg was broken, they passed him by. The neighbors congratulated the farmer on how well things had turned out. "May be," said the farmer.






There is a Taoist story of an old farmer who had worked his crops for many years. One day his horse ran away. Upon hearing the news, his neighbors came to visit. "Such bad luck," they said sympathetically. "May be," the farmer replied.

The next morning the horse returned, bringing with it three other wild horses. "How wonderful," the neighbors exclaimed. "May be," replied the old man.

The following day, his son tried to ride one of the untamed horses, was thrown, and broke his leg. The neighbors again came to offer their sympathy on his misfortune. "May be," answered the farmer.

The day after, military officials came to the village to draft young men into the army. Seeing that the son's leg was broken, they passed him by. The neighbors congratulated the farmer on how well things had turned out. "May be," said the farmer.

** Warning: ☢
** Ratings: ⭐

This is the "text" field value from Tiddler A.






<a href="https://www.paypal.me/cjveniot" target="_blank" style="font-family:verdana; font-size: 12;"><img alt="Tips via PayPal" src="https://cjveniot.neocities.org/SB/TipMe.png"/></a>

\define SetToTitleCaseCap(inputTitle)

<$text text=
{{{ [enlist:raw[$inputTitle$]] +[rest[1]] +[lowercase[]] +[sentencecase[]]  a +[replace[A]] an +[replace[An]] in +[replace[In]] the +[replace[The]] +[join[ ]] [enlist:raw[$inputTitle$]first[1]lowercase[]sentencecase[]] +[putfirst[]] +[join[ ]] }}}/>

\end


* <<SetToTitleCaseCap "SOME TITLE">>
* <<SetToTitleCaseCap "some title">>
* <<SetToTitleCaseCap "an adventure in tiddlywiki filtering, or an otherwise interesting doodad">>
* <<SetToTitleCaseCap "a good time having coffee with a friend">>
* <<SetToTitleCaseCap "the time i laughed to snort in the car">>
* <<SetToTitleCaseCap "the artsy parents who named their kid in' doe ">>
** //here, tricking the filtering process to not see "in" as a word that ought to follow the rule of "short words are lowercase only" by adding a suffix character.//

----

!! The source text before Title Case Capitalization

```
* SOME TITLE
* some title
* an adventure in tiddlywiki filtering, or an otherwise interesting doodad
* a good time having coffee with a friend
* the time i laughed to snort in the car
* the artsy parents who named their kid in' doe

```


----

Ref:  https://apastyle.apa.org/style-grammar-guidelines/capitalization/title-case






<$list filter="[all[tiddlers]tag[TODO]]"/>






So wherever you want to add a TODO in a tiddler, enter something like this:  `{{The Description for the thing you need to do||t2DO}}`

By typing in the description as a tiddler to be transcluded with transclusion template "t2DO", that's where the magic happens.

If the tiddler does not exist, then a button will be created.  Clicking on that button will create the tiddler and tag that tiddler with "TODO".

And that will immediately replace the button with a link to the TODO item.

__''Some examples:''__

* {{My first TODO item||t2DO}}
<<<
Note how the TODO item is preceded by a "TODO" link to the tiddler of same name.  That tiddler lists all tiddlers tagged "TODO".  Just a quick way to get to the full list of TODO's.
<<<


* {{My second TODO item||t2DO}}
<<< 
<<<

* `{{`Your TODO item just waiting for your description and enable the transclusion curly brackets||TODO`}}`

__''The TODO tag and tiddler:''__

* Contents of the [[TODO]] tiddler:

<<<
{{TODO}}
<<<


__''The [[t2DO]] transclusion template tiddler:''__


```
<$list filter="[<currentTiddler>!is[tiddler]]">
<$button>
<$action-createtiddler $basetitle=<<currentTiddler>> tags="TODO"/>
Create ''<<currentTiddler>>'' TODO tiddler
</$button>
</$list>
<$list filter="[<currentTiddler>is[tiddler]]">
[[TODO]]: <$link/>
</$list>
```







currentTiddler = <<currentTiddler>>

Imagine whatever other kind of content, widgets in particular !!!






__''"{{Transcluded Tiddler!!title}}," transcluded with `{{Transcluded Tiddler}}`:''__

<<<
{{Transcluded Tiddler}}
<<<

---

__''"{{Transcluded Tiddler!!title}}," transcluded with `{{||Transcluded Tiddler}}`:''__

<<<
{{||Transcluded Tiddler}}
<<<







* [[Direct Vs Template Transclusion]]






//(i.e. Tiddlers with {{$:/C/Templates!!title}} tags)//

<$details summary="As Pretty Table" >

|!Conditional per Context |{{{ [tag[$:/C/Templates]prefix[c]sort[title]] ||tTi }}} |
|!Tiddler Content Layout |{{{ [tag[$:/C/Templates]prefix[d]sort[title]] ||tTi }}} |
|!Tiddler Link Display Layout |{{{ [tag[$:/C/Templates]prefix[f]sort[title]] ||tTi }}} |
|!Transcluded Tiddler Appearance |{{{ [tag[$:/C/Templates]prefix[t]sort[title]] ||tTi }}} |

</$details>
 
<$details summary="As Simple List" open="yes">

{{$:/C/Templates}}

</$details>






<$vars A={{"A" Data!!text}} B={{"B" Data!!text}}>

* A: __<<A>>__
** //(from [["A" Data]] tiddler)//
* B: __<<B>>__
** //(from [["B" Data]] tiddler)//

<$vars aCount={{{ [<A>split[ ]count[]subtract[1]]}}} bCount={{{ [<B>split[ ]count[]] }}} aLastItem={{{[<A>split[ ]last[1]]}}}>

* aCount: <<aCount>> ^^//(excludes the last item)//^^
* aLastItem: <<aLastItem>>
* bCount: <<bCount>>

!!

* ''Process Results:'' <$list filter="[range<aCount>]" >
<$vars aCurrentItem={{{ [<A>split[ ]nth<currentTiddler>]}}}  aSubstitute={{{ [<B>split[ ]nth<currentTiddler>else<aLastItem>]}}}>
<$text text={{{ [<B>split[ ]] +[match<aCurrentItem>] +[else<aSubstitute>]  }}}/>
</$vars>
</$list><<aLastItem>>

</$vars>
</$vars>







<$link/>: {{!!description}}<br>






<div style="border:1px solid lightgray;">
<center>

''The Goal:  We need a macro to add first-line indents //(5 spaces)// to parapraphs in __stories__.''

</center>
</div>

As sample text for our macro "programming", we will use a version of the "Good, Bad, Maybe" story from [[John Suler's Zen Stories to Tell Your Neighbors|http://truecenterpublishing.com/zenstory/maybe.html]].

{{ The "Maybe" Story, raw text || tAsDc }}

{{ Aside: A little bit of research on spaces || tAsDc }}

{{ A Basic Macro: The Indent Macro || tAsDc }}









<$list filter="[<currentTiddler>get[uid]then<currentTiddler>match<currentTiddler>]">
<$button tooltip={{UID Permalink Button Hint}} aria-label={{UID Permalink Caption}} class=<<tv-config-toolbar-class>>>
<$vars  lb="["
            rb="]"
            thing="#:"
            uid={{{ [<currentTiddler>get[uid]]}}}>
<$vars  the_suffix={{{ [<thing>addsuffix<lb>addsuffix[uid]addsuffix<lb>addsuffix<uid>addsuffix<rb>addsuffix<rb>] }}}>
<$action-sendmessage $message="tm-copy-to-clipboard" $param={{{ [[$:/info/url/full]get[text]addsuffix<the_suffix>] }}}/>
</$vars>
</$vars>
<$list filter="[<tv-config-toolbar-icons>match[yes]]">
{{UID Permalink Button Img}}
</$list>
<$list filter="[<tv-config-toolbar-text>match[yes]]">
<span class="tc-btn-text">
<$text text=" "/>
<$text text={{UID Permalink Caption}}/>
</span>
</$list>
</$button>
</$list>






Get a direct URL link to this tiddler based on a stable and unique identifier (a "UID")






<svg width="22pt" height="22pt" class="tc-image-permalink-button tc-image-button"  viewBox="0 0 128 128" style="border-right:3px dashed blue;"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M80.483 48l-7.387 32h-25.58l7.388-32h25.58zm3.694-16l5.624-24.358c.993-4.303 5.29-6.996 9.596-6.002 4.296.992 6.988 5.293 5.994 9.602L100.598 32h3.403c4.41 0 7.999 3.582 7.999 8 0 4.41-3.581 8-8 8h-7.096l-7.387 32H104c4.41 0 7.999 3.582 7.999 8 0 4.41-3.581 8-8 8H85.824l-5.624 24.358c-.993 4.303-5.29 6.996-9.596 6.002-4.296-.992-6.988-5.293-5.994-9.602L69.402 96h-25.58L38.2 120.358c-.993 4.303-5.29 6.996-9.596 6.002-4.296-.992-6.988-5.293-5.994-9.602L27.402 96h-3.403C19.59 96 16 92.418 16 88c0-4.41 3.581-8 8-8h7.096l7.387-32H24C19.59 48 16 44.418 16 40c0-4.41 3.581-8 8-8h18.177l5.624-24.358c.993-4.303 5.29-6.996 9.596-6.002 4.296.992 6.988 5.293 5.994 9.602L58.598 32h25.58z" style="stroke:blue;stroke-width:9;"/></svg>






UID permalink






<$list filter="[<currentTiddler>get[uid]else<currentTiddler>match<currentTiddler>!is[shadow]]">
<$button tooltip={{UID Setup Button Hint}} aria-label={{UID Setup Caption}} class=<<tv-config-toolbar-class>>>
<$action-setfield $tiddler=<<currentTiddler>> $field="uid" $value={{{ [all[tiddlers]has[uid]get[uid]else[0]maxall[]add[1]] }}}/>
<$list filter="[<tv-config-toolbar-icons>match[yes]]">
{{UID Setup Button Img}}
</$list>
<$list filter="[<tv-config-toolbar-text>match[yes]]">
<span class="tc-btn-text">
<$text text=" "/>
<$text text={{UID Setup Caption}}/>
</span>
</$list>
</$button>
</$list>






Setup a unique identifier (a "UID") for this tiddler.

<br>...
\end

!! The text in some tiddler //(i.e. edit mode)//

<<<
```
\define MacroName()
One or more lines of text
<br>...
<br>...
<br>...
\end

Some content before the macro reference

<<MacroName>>

Some content after the macro reference
```
<<<

!! The rendering of that tiddler's text //(i.e. view mode)//


<<<
<div style="border:1px solid lightgray;">

Some content before the macro reference

<<MacroName>>

Some content after the macro reference

</div>
<<<







! Write it once in a macro, and place macro references anywhere

* instead of repeating the same (however long and however tedious) snippet of text everywhere you need it, enter it once and then enter the shorter macro reference wherever that snippit of text is needed
** whenever that snippet needs to be changed, you only need to change it once and the new version will show everywhere !
** this is very much in line with the philosophy of tiddlers
!!!
* when a snipped of text is actually quite complicated, macros help avoid having that complexity repeated all over the place
** makes it easier to test, makes it easier to fix (fix in one place, instead of fix every place)  

! Cognitive/semantic happiness

* less cognitive overload: a short macro reference is less hard on the brain than a whole bunch of text
!!!
* a well-designed macro name might be helpful to describe what will be rendered at the location of the macro reference, for example:
** `<<CurrHstRate>>`:  //(i.e. current harmonized sales tax)// although longer than simply typing "15%", the macro name sure is descriptive














\define TextWidget(field:"undefined")

<$edit-text tiddler={{{ [<dataTid>is[tiddler]] [<currentTiddler>addsuffix[ Data]] +[first[]] }}} field=$field$ class="std_widget"/>

\end

\define RadioWidget(field:"undefined" value:"undefined" label:"undefined")

<$radio tiddler={{{ [<dataTid>is[tiddler]] [<currentTiddler>addsuffix[ Data]] +[first[]] }}} field=$field$ value=$value$> $label$</$radio>

\end
